job_title: Chief Technology Officer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Positive "Can Do" environment, Positive, solution thinking people
cons: communications - timely - complete - actionable - better understanding of the contributions of the many - not the opinion of the few

review_title: Working for this healthcare system improves your health!
job_title: Oncology Nurse Practitioner in Kingsport, TN
pros: The best reasons to work for Wellmont are the pay, job security, benefits - even for part time employees - there are health programs that PAY you to be healthy with each paycheck.  I receive payment for health club membership.  Every paycheck has extra money on it that I receive for maintaining my weight, blood pressure, and for not smoking.  I also received a retirement matching plan, even as a part time employee.  THere are also benefits of working for such as large system as advertisement of my services, business cards and brochures.  THere are plenty of in-house educational opportunities as well, both related to my job as well as general interest - like financial investment information or personal safety.
cons: There are some downsides to working for Wellmont Health System.  Benefits such as travel for CME are the first things to get cut in economy crunch.  This was not made clear at time of employement.  Being a part of a very large system such as this, one could get lost in the numbers - it is more difficult to stand out and make a difference.  It is also more difficult to wade through the red tape to get even small stuff such as office supplies!  If one waives benefits, there is additional pay on the hour.  However, there is a cap on this, so more highly compensated employees do not get full benefit of this waiver of benefits - for instance instead of the full 20% - I am only getting around 14%.

pros: , friendly atmosphere, loved the patients
cons: , not interested in the community that served their patients

review_title: Good Opportunities to Grow with Company
pros: Dedicated to medicine and technology. Use EPIC system wide to improve patient care. Tries to provide same level of patient care in small towns as it does in large towns. Spends a lot of effort training and educating. Company likes to promote from within and grow their family.
cons: Can get a little too bogged down in rules and regulations. Too behind the times in dress and appearance code. Could update non-medical software as much as medical software.

review_title: After 16 years with the health system, my coworkers are part of my family.
pros: WPS has allowed me to be a working mom and wife.  My family is my top priority, and the management and my team members allow me the ability to accomplish that role, yet while working with some amazing people.  I am very thankful to WHS for the opportunity to work with and serve an awesome community.
cons: I do not have any concerns that I would consider cons to working for WHS.

pros: Most physicians great to work with, caring attitude toward patients, nice to staff. Had direct patient care. Co workers were very helpful, good team approach. Can do payroll deduction for public pharmacy, cafeteria, and gift shop.
cons: No raises for several years, HR is more like gestapo. At  times there was no meal relief. Frequent major changes with no input from those that it affected the most. Each year insurance becomes more expensive with less coverage.

review_title: Great place to work and continually improving their qualtiy of care!
job_title: Clinic Principal Trainer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Continuously finding ways to better their quality of care for patients whether it be by equipment, software or merging with other organizations.
cons: Would have given them a 5-star rating, but feel that they tend to stifle career-enhancing opportunities. Benefits seem to be OK at best - have to get services within their organization for best benefites, but dental is lacking all around.

review_title: RN Supervisor/Admissions @ Wexford House of Wellmont
pros: Recognition of a job well done, appropriate training for any changes, rate of pay with appropriate shift diff, regular pay increases & bonuses.
cons: When applying to new jobs they are slow to respond to applicants. They need to let them know if they are or are not hired in a more timely manner

review_title: My experience with Wellmont Health System has had good and bad times.
job_title: Health Promotion Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: Working in Health Care reaps many benefits of filling a joy of helping people. A lot of great people come in and out of the health care system that you become life long friends with.
cons: Wellmont is without direction as they transition into a merger. Job security is a big factor in deciding whether to stay or find something more promising.

pros: Since leaving the company, most of the senior management has been ousted. Also they are in the process of merging with their main competition.
cons: High deductible health insurance, no employee in-house medical care. Read that as - A major health system that makes their employee's pay more for personal health care than the average patient that comes in the door.

review_title: Horrible turnover rate and low pay.
pros: Wellmont consists of multiple hospitals in the tri-cities area. As such they are a large employer in the area.
cons: Bristol regional has a huge turnover rate.  With feeder schools pumping out fresh graduates who are desperate to find a job into the area, the desire to keep current employees happy is not a top priority.

pros: I just started this past Monday. So I am not sure what every pro is, but I can tell you that the orientation was amazing. The staff seems very helpful and friendly.
cons: I wasn't quiet told when I would start my job hourly work week, and I just found out we are the lowest paid patient transporters in the region.

pros: Some really great employees who care about their work
cons: Favoritism, constant changes that were not necessary (change for the sake of changing), far under payed and when asked for a market adjustment told to wait until next year. I left the company and within 2 months they promoted 2 people in the small department of 8 to manager. Why does 8 people need 3 managers and a director?

job_title: Registered Nurse in Gate City, VA
pros: Their benefits package offers a variety of options to choose from. In addition, they may assist with premium cost if the employee participates in the yearly wellness screening process.
cons: Of course, unless more and more guidelines are met, insurers deny payment.  Therefore, facilities are becoming less family oriented and more "bottom line" oriented.

review_title: Wellmont is a good place to work.
pros: The benefits are good and the organization is respected in the community.
cons: The points system is kind of degrading. However, the reason that it is in place makes it a necessary evil.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Bristol, VA
pros: The staff here is great. I really enjoy working with my colleagues and everyone has been very helpful with anything that I've needed. You couldn't ask for a better department director to work for
cons: Poor pay - at least regionally and nationally. I'm sure locally this is considered good pay but regionally and nationally it is considered very low pay.

review_title: Employed as a Remote Employee, changed
pros: Took the position to work remote, which meant I left a secure position of 10 years.  But, the gave me a raise and promised I could work remote.   Only had to travel in once a week for a team meeting.
cons: After, management changed I was told I would have to commute a long distance daily to work.

pros: Benefits are good and cover a few things at no charge such as mammograms, diabetic supplies
cons: Lack of discipline, favoritism, supervisors are lacking in procedures, lack of management involvement, low pay short handed, expected to do the work in same time with double the work load

job_title: Patient Service Representative in East Kingsport, TN
pros: Opportunity to earn bonus, opportunity to move positions after 6 months.
cons: Pay low for positions, company does not keep you informed ahead of the public about changes within.

pros: Great Benefits, work hours you wanted, co-workers were close as family members
cons: working for someone that showed favoritism to her friends and not the employees , her way or no way and HR would not take action.

pros: Rewarding work knowing that your work impacts the lives of patients.
cons: Benefits are not great. A lot of people are related which makes it difficult to  move upward because of nepotism.

pros: There are many different opportunities for nurses.  If you don't like your present job, you can apply for a different position after 6 months.
cons: The insurance benefits are terrible.  There is a very high deductible and you have to see only Doctor's in the Wellmont System.

cons: It's currently in a bit of disarray because of the merger.  I'm sure things will settle down as the organization gets established.
